intro: Stachytarpheta glabra, commonly known as white sage, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist or wetland habitats. Stachytarpheta glabra is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
